Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay last week at the Georgian Court Hotel. One of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed at. I travel a lot and it is nice every once and a while that you get upgraded. I was very surprised to see what a wonderful room I was upgraded to. Thanks to the great staff at the Georgian Court hotel you made my night.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Vanislandergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georgian Court hotel on a trip to Vancouver to see a Canucks game and ended up staying longer than planned in part due to the excellent location of the hotel. We arrived and were given a room on the Orchid floor, which offers great extras for female guests. They had styling appliances and great hair products and the staff was super friendly. The parking (which can be really expensive in Vancouver) was very reasonable and the food at the restaraunt was good value as well. I would certainly return to this hotel for future trips to games as the location is pretty much unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: Mbilgincan
Reviews.Content: İ was extremely happy staying at the georgia court hotel during the canada international film festival. They had a special deal for fetival participants and everything was the most one can expect for the price i paid. İts sister restaurant is also great value!

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind0
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at the Georgian Court Hotel. The staff was awesome, very helpful & the rooms very clean. We would definitely stay there again. We were going to the Canucks game that night, the arena was only steps away from the hotel which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Close to QE II Theatre & BC Place”
Reviews.Author: NachoMama520
Reviews.Content: A luxury hotel available at a more modest price. We always find this a quiet & comfortable place to stay, with comfortable beds and high quality amenities. The proximity to the Queen Elizabeth Theatre makes it an ideal locale for our stays for Vancouver Opera performances. The new bar and bistro (Frankie's) are very nice as well. The staff is unusually helpful and attentive. Georgian Court is our first choice for a comfortable stay in downtown Vancouver... As a side note: When traveling with female friends, we always try to be housed on the Orchid Floor - for women only - because the extra pampering is just right - and we're spoiled enough to think we deserve it!!

Reviews.Title: “weekend get-away”
Reviews.Author: Rina T
Reviews.Content: we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the georgian court hotel. i highly recommend them for their excellent customer service, classy rooms with extra ammenities and ours had a great view of the city, central location to downtown, and just an over-all feel good experience after our much needed weekend get-away. we wil definitely stay here the next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: soniya35805
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel while visiting Vancouver with my husband and 2 children by the reviews on trip advisor and yelp. Excellent value for the price. The place is wonderful. It is like a luxury hotel feel but intimate. The rooms are beautiful, clean and it is in a great locations. The parking fee is very reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. The staff is so helpful and polite. We followed the advice of a gentleman at the front desk on activities to do in the area and had a wonderful day. And we enjoyed the hot tub every night after the hiking and walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KirstenJoy
Reviews.Content: I had such a great experience when I stayed here 2 weeks ago. Service was great, rooms were gorgeous and so was the lobby! When I first entered the room, there was a personalized, hand written card with Lindt chocolate as well! Great welcome to the hotel! Also, there was the usual hotel items such as shampoo, soap etc, but this hotel had so much more to offer! There was a hair straightener, curler, weighing scale, a safe, bathrobes, slippers, first aid, even pantyhose and ear plugs! I was really impressed by what they had to offer! All the staff was really friendly, housekeepers also offering us Lindt chocolate whenever they were around! Beds were comfy, everything clean and updated. Location is also great, close to the heart of the city. Would return in a heart beat as I was really impressed. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Oh-so Central!”
Reviews.Author: smishsmash
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week ago and really enjoyed it. Nice location within walking distance to most downtown areas. Plus, they have complementary bikes to use if you're tired of walking! Front desk staff were very nice and helpful. Nice room. View was lacking as we were next to new construction, but what can you do?

Reviews.Title: “A lovely escape in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: jillp76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Georgian Court for a week last month. It is a fabulous hotel! The rooms are clean, well-appointed with lovely Aveda products, slippers, and robes! It is a great home away from home. The beds are so comfortable - it was hard to get up in the mornings! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Vancouver for business or pleasure. The location is great - close to shopping on Robson, great restaurants in Gastown and Yaletown, and of course the sports facilities are right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas trip”
Reviews.Author: jimgull
Reviews.Content: We purchased a "yahoo Travelzoo" special for the Georgian Court, and feel that we got an exceptional deal for a very nice hotel. All of the personnel that we dealt with in the hotel were very helpful and friendly. It was located at the bottom of Robson street - and very convenient to walk downtown to various attractions (also directly across from BC place). The first night we ate at Frankies Italian Kitchen in the hotel. Both the food and the service were excellent! We would definitely go back again - and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay At The Georgian”
Reviews.Author: Kvos1
Reviews.Content: I dropped off my bags at 11am and they told me my room was already ready for me, I had a meeting to go to before that so when I arrived at 3pm they greeted me by name and the check in process only took a matter of minutes. When we got to our room it was breathtaking with clean the rooms were and the lovely Aveda products. After we got settled in we went down to the hot tub and steam room they were very well kept and very clean. In the morning there was complementary tea and coffee and a paper waiting outside my door! Check out went very well and I left with a smile on my face :)

Reviews.Title: “orchid rooms are lovely”
Reviews.Author: annitimble
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation 3 weeks previously, and was assured that I would have an orchid room. That was not the case when I arrived. The hotel was sold out, an NHL game was on and they are very close and handy to the Rogers arena, for all you hockey fans!! I think they gave me the last room, which was on the 3rd floor right by the elevators, and right out the window was where the construction zone was. Now to be fair, in very tiny print they wrote the following on my thank you for booking : As a downtown property, city construction is part of our urban environment landscape. With that said, there is a new development project within our vicinity. We are committed to providing you with the utmost of comfort and superior service. Please feel free to contact us with any special requests. I think that handing out ear plugs upon check in would be a good idea. Since I wasn't given an orchid room,(the 10th floor is called the orchid floor and has special amenities for us ladies!)the night clerk had sent up a basket of these goodies, which was very nice. The bed was very comfortable ,and the room very clean. The check in service was pleasant and efficient and really only said the orchid rooms are based on availability at check in, and a request is not a guarantee even though I'd been assured of it when I made the reservation on the phone. And they would move me the next day. It should not have come as a surprise to be woken up at 7:30 to jack hammers.... but it was! And I know it isn't their fault. Hence the ear plug note at the beginning. I wonder if they could inquire with guests at check-in , if they were early risers or hoping to sleep in..and give out the rooms accordingly. I had an important medical appointment, and had hoped for a quiet gentle start to my up coming appointments. I just left my room as quickly as possible, besides the noise , the wireless internet (also free, thank you), kept cutting out. I left my packed bags, as I was told they would move them to my new room while I was out. When I returned in the late afternoon, I was given an orchid room... What a treat.. Better linen, a comfy sofa and several magazines too. But no bags. The desk clerk couldn't find them. I suggested he look in my old room, and he showed up with them shortly thereafter. If I had had this room for both nights , my review would have had top rating. This room was on the opposite side from the construction, thank goodness. When I checked out, I asked what the policy was regarding giving out the rooms. No real answer, although I was given the managers card and told he would be able to answer the questions better. It was great that parking was included in the price too. I definitely will go back again. It has a lovely look and feel. And perhaps the construction will be over....

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and well situated”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: From the friendly greeting the moment we walked in the door through to checkout we found the staff to be professional and genuinely welcoming. The rooms are quite nice and the overall cleanliness of the facility is very good. The location is excellent if you are going to an event at BC Place, Rogers Arena or the nearby theatres. It’s also an easy walk to Gastown, Chinatown and downtown shopping. Self-parking was only $15.00/day, a bargain for the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous+Clean+Location+Extras”
Reviews.Author: jessica P
Reviews.Content: What a welcome hotel after a poor experience at another hotel. We were in Vancouver for 9 days and after 2 at the previous hotel, we had to check out. Checked into Georgian Court and it was lovely! We did have a small issue though. We called from the other hotel to make arrangements and spent a few hours repacking all our things and getting lunch before heading over to Georgian Court. When we arrived, we were told there was a problem with our reservation and the King room we had booked was not actually available and that we'd have to take a room with 2 double beds. We were set on our king bed though and we had to pay an extra $30/night to upgrade. Despite this being the hotel's fault, we received no compensation but rather had to pay more. We didn't even get a phone call once they noticed the mistake to warn us. However, we were pretty much over it when we saw our exec. suite, just like it looks on the website. The bed was comfy, the room was spacious and clean, and they have Aveda products. Deluxe sized in the suites :) There is a Lady's floor on the 10th floor, but we were not on that floor. I asked if I could have one of the gift baskets that come in those rooms and it was no problem! Housekeeping brought a huge basket with all your hair tools plus hairspray, pantyhose, InStyle and Vanity Fair, and other girly essentials. It was a nice treat indeed! It is really about the little things that a hotel does, and Georgian Court has it covered with their special touches, the robes and slippers, the complimentary umbrellas, and the service whether we needed a corkscrew or whatever, it was at our door in minutes. Oh and did I mention location? It's 2 blocks from the Stadium-Chinatown skytrain and International Village shopping center. If it's yucky out or you don't feel like walking, the complimentary shuttle takes you anywhere you need to go as long as it isn't busy. You can always make a reservation though. Oh, and they had the best fitness facilities I've seen in a hotel! A free weight set with a huge weight machine and all the basics- treadmill, elliptical and bike. Also towels, water and a TV, but I don't know what's with the TV remote, that thing is ginormous. The steam room was out of service the day we arrived, but back in business shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Tamara W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georigian Court for a little weekend getawya and it was amazing. It is a very nice little boutique Hotel which has been totally updated. It holds fantastic Aveda amenties in the room and I was very pleased to find a curling iron and flat iron as I had left mine at home. We found the room very quiet and peaceful, we couldn't here street noise or other guests. We also enjoyed the whirlpool which was a nice treat at the end of a long week. I would definitely recommend the Geogian Court.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds!!”
Reviews.Author: Janisinbc
Reviews.Content: We were just here for one night in a suite room. It included a bed and a hide away couch - both were very comfortable - and I have never slept in a hideaway that was this comfy. The shower was nice and hot - relaxing. Love the Aveda products too, makes me feel like I am in a spa... Also the idea that bottles of water were free/part of the amenities of the room and that there was a separate kettle to make tea rather than having to use the coffee maker and having coffee flavored tea. The staff are excellent, very attentive and accomodating. Had chocolates and turn down service for the night mmm. Unfortunately, we were on the back of the hotel and there is construction going on in the next lot - they start up very early and are very noisy - not the hotels fault - if we were staying more than one night, I would have asked for a different room. We ate at the restaurant - Frankies (in the hotel) - for breakfast and it was very good and reasonably priced. Again staff excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Retreat After A Wild Concert”
Reviews.Author: Chilliwack1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had never stayed at this hotel when we've come in to see Concert's at Roger's Arena....This Hotel is Pure Elegence! Staff were Lovely, Lovely Lobby Waiting Area...Excellent Walking Distance to Roger's Arena. Price was Excellent for Location...Our Room was Amazingly Super Quiet...They Accomodated to my various Allergy related Request's.Room was Tastefully Done having everything you need, if I remember correctly you even had a complementary Newspaper outside your door when you got up...Everything was Wonderful, Nothing Negative to say about our Stay at this Hotel...Definately a great place to stay when Visiting The Downtown part of Vancouver and requiring a Comfortable, Clean, Affordable, Safe Hotel... Trip Advisor Asks when did you stay? Although our Stay was a few years ago, we came in for the Nickelback Dark Horse Tour Concert, I'll have to select from the last date possible in order to submit this...

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location :-)”
Reviews.Author: Nobblets
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night after our company New Years party and loved the hotel. The staff were helpful, the location is good and the price much better than 4 blocks away. When we arrived the lobby was full, when we checked out the lobby was full - but we only waited a moment to check in/out! They obviously had a full hotel that weekend but their service was excellent and we never noticed any problems with them being busy. Our room was also very quiet, we slept like babies without our kids!!! The coolest part was riding the elevator with Canada's Women's National Soccer Team who were in town playing for the 2012 CONCACAF Women's Olympic Qualifying tournament. A highlight as a proud viewer of girls soccer! We even got to meet Karina Leblanc!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the chocolates :)”
Reviews.Author: Islandqb
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful room, top notch. The only downside is that the elevators can be slow and there is no option to take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Idéalement placé. Chambres luxueuse.”
Reviews.Author: ethanea
Reviews.Content: Les chambres sont luxueuse, propres, calmes. Le lit est très large et le matelas très confortable. Le personnel à été très réactif et présent. L'aide fournie est toujours utile et donnée avec le sourire. Service impeccable. La navette gratuite est idéale pour vous amener partout dans le centre. Il y a également toujours des taxi disponibles devant l'hôtel. Super hôtel. Si j'avais une fausse note à donner, ce serait la réception TV est analogique et le wifi, gratuit pour tous, est parfois lent. Sans ça: parfait. J'y retournerait sans hésiter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: beverlydeg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georgian Court hotel both before and after our Alaskan cruise. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and the location was good. I found a coupon on the Vancouver Web site (http://www.hellobc.com/vancouver), which entitled us to a free night if you stay 2 nights. Everything in Vancouver is a bit pricey, but we found the Old Spaghetti Factory in Gastown, which we felt was very reasonable. The food was good and the portions were more than adequate. Highly recommend this restaurant. The restaurant is located about a 15 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gadabout1941
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel through Travelzoo.com and invited a friend to go along with me. The hotel is centrally located between Gastown, Chinatown, and Yaletown and an easy walk to these areas. It's at the foot of Robson Street, so walking to see the shops on that street is completely doable. The restaurant in the hotel, Frankie's, is wonderful; breakfast was really good and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “christmas 2011 stay at Georgian Court Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimhans
Reviews.Content: Excellent front desk team, providing suggestions for things to do. Room was very nice with a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-rounder”
Reviews.Author: steelydom
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a 3 week British Columbia holiday. Really handy location to bars and restaurants and the staff were really nice - we were off a overnight bus from Jasper so we were very weary! Rooms were great and clean and the price is well worth it - have payed a lot more for a lot less. We were facing on to BC place the day of the season opener and noise was still not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: trainfan2000
Reviews.Content: This is our hotel of choice whenever we are catching a cruise ship or the train into or out of Vancouver. It is close to downtown yet out of the crowds and hustle and bustle found a few blocks away. It is a quick ride to the train station or cruise ship port and only about a $30 taxi ride to the airport. The Skyrail station for Chinatown is about a five minute walk away. If you take the intercity bus to Victoria it drops off about one block from the hotel. The rooms are a good size and well appointed. The mattresses are comfortable, the linens excellent quality, and I have never been bothered by background noise. A laundry with reasonably priced washer and dryer is available. The whirlpool is a delight to relax in after a day of sightseeing. Free Internet connection is available and for those of us who don't carry laptops there are free computers available in the business center. The staff is knowledgeable and friendly and very willing to help you in any way they can. The attached restaurant has an excellent breakfast at a very reasonable cost - no need to go anywhere else in the morning. In summary, this is small (12 floors) hotel that offers big hotel service. The location is excellent with easy access to all forms of public transportation. The staff is friendly and will go above and beyond to help you. Excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Finetraveller
Reviews.Content: I am a Diamond Hilton Member so I typically stay down the street at the Hampton Inn. I decided for a change to stay at the Georgia Court Hotel and I was delighted with the difference. The hotel is a small "luxury" hotel but I'm not sure if I would give it 5 stars. Instead, I would say it is a solid 4 star boutique reminding me of a Fairmont, although my recent Fairmont stays have not been all that great. The hotel staff at the Georgia were excellent and there is a free shuttle to get you to downtown locations. The room was immaculate, not sprayed and had every amenity, (a kettle!) and some nice products in the bathroom. Marble counter tops in the bathroom and it seemed recently renovated. I had breakfast each morning in Frankie's the restaurant in the hotel and it was incredible, (much better than microwaved eggs at the Hampton Inn). For $10 you get a great plate of food. I also dined in the same restaurant in the evening with friends and everyone was very pleased- great value and fresh fresh food. Great service at all meals. All in all a great stay.Somehow the best word to describe my stay would be "delightful"-I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the money”
Reviews.Author: AlanaPot
Reviews.Content: Placed conveniently across the road from BC Place this hotel is suitable for more than just your average sportsfan! Rooms are well appointed and top floors have lovely views of the stadium especially at night with its glowing new roof. Service is excellent, very friendly and staff will help with every need. The whirpool and steamroom are newly renovated, clean and have an abundance of fluffy towels. Well placed for walking anywhere in Vancouver city, it was a fantastic base from which to enjoy various neighbourhoods and all the sights. Room service is available from the hotel's Italian restaurant and is highly recommended for jetlaggers and those taking the weight off their travel weary feet. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: erjennif
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal for the Georgian Court on Travel Zoo. We really enjoyed our stay and will be keeping our eyes open for another deal so we can enjoy some pampering again! Very comfortable room with a king-size bed and sitting area. Nice restaurant (Frankie's Kitchen - good food and service) on site. Close to Stadium-Chinatown Skytrain station, Rogers Arena, GM place, Queen Elizabeth Theatre, the Playhouse, The Centre, and shopping. Only one small complaint...the elevator floor wasn't level with the floor on our level. I took quite the fall when getting out of the elevator one afternoon. I brought it up to the front desk staff, and the fellow seemed concerned and said he'd call maintenance to have it looked at and fixed. We were only there for one more day, but the problem hadn't been fixed yet when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done!”
Reviews.Author: MarkSSeattle
Reviews.Content: We last saw the Georgian Court before the Olympics when it was being remodeled and some relatives were staying there. We just stayed for a weekend and were very impressed. We had a corner suite, which they upgraded us to (apparently since occupancy over the weekend was not high). Everything about the hotel was comfortable and well thought out. For instance, there were two sets of disposable earplugs in the room. The location is not noisy, but is right across the street from BC Place and Rogers Arena. Presumably the ear plugs are for people attending noisy events at these venues. The room also had two robes, slippers, free bottled water, coffee and tea along with the coffee maker and rapid water heater. There was a mini-fridge, and (God bless them) no mini-bar. My wife was thrilled with the Aveda toiletries, and the sheets were so soft she asked housekeeping where she could buy them. The decor of the hotel is bright, with tasteful carpeting and wallpaper. The hot tub and steam room were clean and worked well. Equipment in the exercise room was health club quality. Staff at the front desk was consistently pleasant and helpful. It was rainy, and the hotel had an ample supply of umbrellas for guests to use. There is an Italian restaurant attached that looked nice, though we didn't try it. The location can't be beat if you don't mind doing a little walking. We walked without difficulty to Yaletown, Chinatown, Gastown, and the shopping areas along Robson. The hotel offers bicycles for free customer use (we inquired, but didn't use them). We've stayed at a number of hotels in Vancouver over the years, and the Georgian Court rates high on the price/value scale. To be fair, we benefited from a special rate offered by one of the coupon sites, but generally available rates for the dates we stayed were still very reasonable. This will be the first place we'll check for future trips to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: brendadoug
Reviews.Content: Our second experience at the Georgian Court was once again exceptional. The hotel is directly across from the new stadium, within 5 mins to Rogers Arena and Queen Elizabeth and Ford Theaters. Also within walking distance to downtown shopping. Therefore the location is perfect for sporting events,concerts and the theater. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious. We would recommend the Georgian Court for an downtown activity.

Reviews.Title: “Very niiiice”
Reviews.Author: Hourray
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from the 4th through the 6th and honestly i would go back! Pros - great location (40 min to Stanley park and 15 to shopping on Robson; close to the rogers arena and the stadium as well as great restaurants) - very quiet ; had a neighbor but hardly heard him (connecting room) and didn 't hear traffic. We were on the 9th floor) - aveda products in the washroom - large room -have to use ur key card in the elevator (increases security) Cons - didn t manage to clise the curtain all the way so wold be awaken by sunlight in the am -it's right across the way from the stadium so beware on game day

Reviews.Title: “Good location, otherwise just blah ...”
Reviews.Author: buzz101
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night, but will probably try other hotels when staying in Downtown again. Location was great, rooms were rather small but adequate and well appointed, fairly clean. As others said, view was into office building next door. No pool, but did have hot tub and steam room - very little ambiance in that area, could do a lot to make it a better experience. Showers at the hot tub had no soap or shampoo, so really couldn't use it. When we came back from late night dining we wanted to make some caffeine free tea ... only ONE camomile tea bag ... went downstairs to ask for another and the front desk wasn't too helpful, suggested that I ask as the restaurant for a teabag ... really???? Ended up bringing us another teabag ... We didn't have any big issues, but small things we would've expected as the hotel is highly rated and part of 'boutique chain' - not sure what that exactly means after visiting there. Good place if you want somewhere decent to sleep when attending events in Rogers Stadium or QE theater.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: LaToya X
Reviews.Content: Front desk and housekeeping were very responsive and friendly. I like how they welcomed all the dogs by name. I enjoyed my stay here. Hotel is in downtown next to BC place and walking distance from the science center, china town, gas town, yale town and everything you want to see. I had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Service above room size”
Reviews.Author: DestinyVP
Reviews.Content: A high level of service makes this an easy hotel to recommend after a five day stay. The location is fantastic as it is close to both downtown and BC Place. The two doubles room on the 8th floor featured a view of the lunch room in the office tower next door. For a tourist that would be disappointing, but for a business person its isn't such an issue. A good night's sleep was easy to find, though the other business people in the hotel might wake you early on the way to meetings. The fridge was missing in our room but one was located and delivered to the room. An upgrade later in our stay to a 1 Bedroom suite, showed that the bedroom in the suite had better isolation from street noise. The suite also featured a few more amenities such as a mending kit, second bottle of shampoo and two bathrobes and slippers vs the deluxe double's one. Sink in the double room was in the bathroom. In the suite the sink was in the bedroom. Both rooms had a desk. The suite also had a good deal of living space and a dining table. The double room was quite small. Both rooms had low shower heads. Anybody over 5'9" will have to figure how to duck under the water. It seems silly to mention it as the overall experience was so positive but the tall should be warned. Wi-fi was free and worked fine, if a little slow at times, and wired internet was also good, with a cord included in the room desk. The business office had free printing and two computers for easy access. We saw the hot tub and work out room but used neither. Front desk can be relied on any time day or night for quick friendly service. Ask about the casino booklets if you're on your way to the Edgewater. Frankies restaurant had amazing food and we dined there repeatedly during our stay. Parking was included in my rate and was an easy in and out with the room key. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WakeupNow
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal staying here and was blown away by the location ( right in Trendy Yale Town), price($99/night). It was right across from the BC Place so a bonus there if you have a Canuks game or event to see. The area is safe at all hours and the resturant in the hotel was inexpensive but the service top notch!! WoW! 'Frankies'. We got treated like VIP! Even our snobby kids liked it and will go back to that resturant because they are locals. (only kidding about the snobby part).

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if the Hampton Inn is full”
Reviews.Author: mark_mb
Reviews.Content: Just down the road from the Hampton Inn. My room was gloomier than what I remembered from the Hampton Inn. Breakfast was not included in the price, but quite good. Easy walk to some good restaurants in Yaletown. Not sure why they are part of the small luxury hotels chain, I'd expect more from a chain like that.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - liked it”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTraveller12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of September and this really is a very nice place, the rooms are not all that new but 100% clean, maintained and comfortable - great staff on reception and in the bar. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are just too many places in Vancouver for good food but the hotel is in a good position and in only a few minutes you can walk up Robson Street and you are spoilt for choice with regard to bars, restaurants and shops. If we do come back to Vancouver this will be the place that we stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: abc123001
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel was a great place to stay. Easy to get to by train on the Canada line from the airport. Shuttle bus will take you to the shops and to Canada place where you can get tickets to all the shows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 20 somethings couple trying to explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: Novascotiagirl24
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The rooms were a traditional hotel room- no extra frills but not subpar either. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect, especially for someone who is coming to see a hockey game or football game. The other pleasant surprise was the comparably low parking rate. All in all, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: size10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two days beginning of September and the again for five days later in the month whilst in vancouver. We both loved the place and if ever on Vancouver would not bother looking anywhere else but just book Georgisn Court again. Rooms are well furnished, spacious , quiet and very clean. The beds are unbelievably comfortable, bathrooms are lovely.Staff at front desk very friendly,polite and helpful. When you stay there check out the toilets on the mezzanine floor, they are amazing. Hotel is six minute walk to Skytrain which will take you everywhere including 26 minute trip to airport. BC stadium and Rogers Arena 5 minute walk. Closet shopping centre 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mosTulsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. The location was great. It was easy to get around from there. The staff was friendly and very helpful with transportation and sight seeing suggestions. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, style and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: KelownaBC_family
Reviews.Content: You could not ask for anything more in a hotel! The location was perfect, the rooms stylish, clean and comfortable! And the rate was affordable for a downtown hotel. Definitely eat at Frankies, as their pasta is to die for! Overall a great hotel! Though keep in mind you may not get the room you were told you were getting, our only problem!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scumdude
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and clean. Doors need to be sound proofed though. I could hear all the noises coming from the hallway, including doors slamming all throughout the night. Comfortable bed with friendly staff. Hotel is located near Yaletown, which is a short 10 minute walk from downtown. Drugstore and lots of food places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Sealbark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night on a 24 hour visit to Vancouver. The rooms were nice and clean. The bed was perfect. I was worried about it being only a full bed but ended up getting my best sleep at this hotel. We enjoyed our breakfast at the hotel restaurant as well. I didn’t know about the free shuttle to downtown but we already had a bicycle tour all set up. I liked the location. Even though it wasn’t right in the downtown area, it wasn’t a far walk to the art gallery, public library, Robson street shopping and Yaletown. We paid $175 after taxes (on hotels.com) and felt like that was a really good price for what we got and for comparable hotels in Vancouver. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Wendygoesaround
Reviews.Content: Very good service, rooms a little dated but very clean and very comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice - Not Exactly in the Heart of Things”
Reviews.Author: Colocav
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights on business, property was selected by my client. Right across the street from the football stadium and close to the hockey arena but not close to other downtown attractions. Front desk service was very good/accommodating. The restaurant service (2 breakfasts) left a little to be desired. Room and bathroom were good but a little dated. They actually have 1970s "house" style door knockers on each room door. I thought the "special" rate of $199 CAN was a little pricey for the type of property.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rudi K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our three night stay. The hotel is conveniently located for seeing the main sights, the room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We enjoyed the complimentary newspaper, bottle of water and downtown shuttle, which we took to go to Stanley Park. The shuttle driver was very helpful, knowledgeable and made us feel welcome. The staff at the front desk were also helpful in answering questions on where to find the places we wanted to visit. And we enjoyed the free internet service, which allowed us to stay in touch with family during our vacation. We definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dan907
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end we enjoyed our stay at this conveniently located hotel. The desk service staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The hotel is within a short walking distance of a number of Vancouver venues including Rogers Arena. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location downtown”
Reviews.Author: TheYarralls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights while passing through Vancouver. The location was perfect for seeing all the central sites, including Stanley Park which was about a 40 minute walk away, Granville Island, and the centre of town, including stations for the Canada Line to the airport. Our room was big and clean, and staff very friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel, but there are plenty of options close by for any meal of the day.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: melissaC2
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the Georgian Court while in Vancouver for a couple of days. We booked directly with the hotel after reading good reviews. The reservation clerk was very informative and helpful. We loved the free WIFI, that was one of the biggest draws for us. We arrived after a four night Via train ride from Ontario, the staff at reception were courteous and helpful, check in was a breeze. Our room was on the 12th floor it was welcoming, large and clean,we had a view of BC Place. Loved the Aveda Products, bathrobe and slippers .We ordered room service from Frankie's, the restaurant downstairs and it was delicious and prompt. The Frankie's Pizza , and Seafood Linguine was FANTASTIC. Our bed was comfy and we had a great nights sleep. We took the breakfast with our room reservation, and it was well worth it, service was good and we were out in good time to catch the ferry to Victoria. We had rented a car so location wasn't an issue ,but it is in a very good location. On Beatty a block from Robson St. The staff was helpful giving us direction, and tips to find places and getting around the city. We spent a night and a day in Victoria, and returned to Georgian Court were we went down to the restaurant this time, for dinner. Excellent again , this time Salad and appitizer Chicken Linguine and a frankie's pizza. I would definitely stay there again should I have the opportunity to revisit, and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Anbee27
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a weekend trip from Seattle to Vancouver to meet up with friends who were visiting. Happened to book this hotel via Expedia. I had seen the reviews from previous guests and decided to take the chance. I have to say that we had a great experience. We have a 17 month old and we had a very comfortable stay. I gave 4 and 1/2 stars because of the BC Place construction. Once that is done its 5 stars all the way. Pros: 1) Great location. It is opposite the Vancouver Canucks stadium, in downtown so you can walk to the shops, the art gallery and eating joints. 2) It’s a small boutique hotel so it was really neat and clean 3) Very accommodating management. The air conditioning in the room we first got was really loud and they were able to change us to a different one even though it was midnight. I am sure we got lucky that the place was not full on the day we checked in but I was very happy with how obliging and apologetic they were about the poor experience we had the first time around 4) Free WiFi and purified water. It was so good to not have to worry about looking for a store to buy water or having to pay the exorbitant rates for water that other hotels charge Cons: 1) The location. It is right opposite the BC Place Stadium that is being constructed so there is a lot of noise during the day and of course there is a little bit of dust as well 2) The hotel does not have a restaurant in house (there is a restaurant attached to the hotel) so room service essentially means ordering in.

Reviews.Title: “If u need/want to be downtown, especially for rogers arena/bc place!!”
Reviews.Author: hawaii1201
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georgian while attending Sade Concert at Rogers arena! Great great location.... reasonable prices....very clean.....great bedding and pillows.....friendly staff......would stay again especially to be near great attractions and walking distance to everything downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Fungster
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Georgian Court Hotel for 4 nights for the Civic Holiday long-weekend. Booked months ago through Booking.com at a very good rate. Hotel front desk staff were very polite and helpful. Spent a few minutes with us to search online for dessert places that were still open at 10PM. Room was nice and generally clean. However, cleaning staff did minimal job with the daily service. Towels left on the vanity were not replaced. Only the ones thrown inside the tub were. Room was pretty dusty from the linen and towels because there was a layer of dust on the water kettle every day despite my effort wipe it off each time. Cleaning staff did not refill the complimentary water every day and did not clean out the kettle each day. And I'm sure the bed sheets were not changed throughout the entire 4-night stay despite their policy to change it every 2-3 days. My friends stayed in another room on another floor and their cleaning person was very eager to clean their room each day, knocking on their door and calling their room for house keeping despite the PRIVATE sign out on their door. Overall, still a pleasant stay. The beds were really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room & great service”
Reviews.Author: phylloef
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Georgian Court Hotel after returning from a cruise in Alaska. We arrived in Vancouver early, went to the hotel to drop off our bags and explore the city. The hotel checked us in immediately, then provided free bikes & helmets for the day! Bottles of water are free too! The rooms are nicely done with comfy beds and Aveda toiletries. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We had breakfast in the restaurant as part of our package. We also had dinner there one evening. The food was quite good, and the staff provided exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MelZim
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was fabulous. The room was beautiful and you can't go wrong with the Aveda products. They have everything you could possibly need complimentary in the room - mouthwash, nail polish remover, hair straightener, cotton balls ... the list goes on and on. The elevators are a bit wonky and the restaurant staff left a lot to be desired but the hotel room itself was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSnow
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is a pick up point for the Rocky Mountaineer. The hotel is great, with a spacious room and very comfortable bed. It was also easy to get a cab around this location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good value, staff who value your business”
Reviews.Author: Anniekn
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place! While it's not directly downtown, the location is excellent - close to the Stadium/Chinatown SkyTrain station as well as the water taxis to Granville, so it was super easy to get around. It took about 10 minutes to walk to Robson, hardly a big deal. I suspect the hotel would be considerably more expensive if it were right downtown. There's a lovely waterfront park just a couple blocks away. Yaletown is also nearby, and there are a lot of interesting restaurants there. I was very impressed at how customer service-oriented they were even before we checked in. The week before our stay they sent us a personalized Guest Folio that offered ideas about things to do in Vancouver. It also highlighted all the amenities and services of the hotel and stressed their willingness to assist with reservations for dinner, spa treatments or site seeing excursions. It seems they really care and want to go out of their way to make your stay an enjoyable experience and not just another hotel stay. If you're celebrating a special occasion like a birthday or an anniversary during your stay, it seems like the staff would be willing to accommodate special requests. My only caveat, and it's not a big deal, just make sure not to venture too far to the east of the hotel neighborhood, which I think might be Gastown - that area looked pretty rough. But we didn't see anything too weird around the hotel itself and we were out walking at night. All in all, a very good visit. The next time I am in Vancouver, I will not hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: AlissaRenault
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I had to come to Vancouver for a wedding and we wanted to spend a day on our own before we met up with the rest of our group. We found the Georgian Court hotel online and decided to book. Seemed like very good Value. We got to the hotel early and didn't think that we could check in. Our cab pulled up and we didn't see anyone outside to help us with our bags, (being girls away, we had a few each) but the guy at the front desk came out and gave us a hand. So nice. He brought us in, laughing and joking with us the whole way. Instantly we felt comfortable. He was really casual and it's nice to see that attitude when you get to a hotel. Thinking we were going to have to store our bags and wait a few hours, the desk agent, (Daniel is his name) found us a room right away on the ladies floor. Even gave us an upgrade at no cost saying he didn't want us to have to wait until check in time. So nice! We went to our room and were pleasantly surprised. Love the touches and the idea of a ladies only floor. I travel for business as well and if I had the option of staying on a ladies floor all the time, I would jump at the opportunity. I have to say, the hotel's exterior is pretty drab looking, the lobby is overwhelmingly beige, but the rooms were great and oh my god the beds are incredible! Very centrally located. They've got a decent hot tub free internet that actually works and a great hotel restaurant too. After we settled in, we went back down to the desk to find out a little more about the hotel and the city. Daniel recommended us some amazing restaurants, and managed to get us a reservation at one of his favorite spots. It didn't disappoint either. The boy knows his food! He also got us on the guest list at a club for after. Check out was easy, but we were sad to leave. This stay was great from start to finish. We had an incredible time in Vancouver and The Georgian Court was the perfect stop over before the wedding! I would absolutely stay at this hotel again, if not for the hotel itself, we'd go back for the service.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: coral3Waterloo
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with this hotel for its service, friendliness,security and the great rate we received. The room was well appointed and comfortable. the bedding and beds were excellent and everything was extremely clean. Nice touch was free bottles of water and a kettle in the room for tea drinkers. Girls, ask for the Orchid floor with nice little extras. Any time I'm in Vancouver I'll be staying at the Georgian Court.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Karzack
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Georgian Court in 2008 and intended to stay at a different hotel with good review and we decided to stay in YWCA for 4 nights, however after spending one night we moved to Georgian Court because despite slightly more expensive (around $25/night), the higher quality of bedding, larger room, free Wi-fi and complimentary bike rental more than make up for it. Actually, it is very noticable that the service quality this time is even better than 3 years ago as the staff went the extra mike to answer any question and help in anyway they can to make our stay that much more enjoyable...KUDOS for the management and staff ! Keep up the good work guys!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with good transport links and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kaysafus
Reviews.Content: The Georgian Court Hotel is a smart hotel located near the Stadium Sky Train stop (there is a direct line from the train station which we found very useful). You can also get a free shuttle fro the hotel to downtown (presumably it is also possible to get picked up although we didn’t try). Although I got the impression it was often used for business travellers, we had a really nice stay at the hotel. We arrived at around ten in the morning and weren’t sure whether we’d be able to check in, but the reception staff were very friendly and helpful, and got us a room immediately. Our room was fairly large with two queen size beds. The bathroom was enormous and the shower was really good with lots of pressure settings. We had a three course dinner in the restaurant attached to the hotel, which was really good. The starters were excellent – I had a really fresh Caesar salad, and the dressing was probably the nicest I’ve ever had. The main courses were nice, but the portion sizes weren’t huge (there were three small potatoes on my plate). The puddings made up for the small mains as they were huge – I had tiramisu and it was twice the size I was expecting. The waiter who served us was really friendly and helpful. The only downside for me was that the air conditioning was turned up quite high, but I was ok with a cardigan on! We also had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and it was fabulous – really big portion sizes that tasted excellent. The coffee was ok too, which was refreshing as we found it was over-brewed in a lot of other hotels. The only downside I can really think of with the hotel was the coffee in the room which was revolting – it tasted like bacon frazzles. In the grand scheme of things, this wasn’t really a major problem as we had a really good night’s sleep and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility”
Reviews.Author: LBurns2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel overall was quite nice, however When we arrived to our room they had us on the third floor when I specificly booked the orcid floor when I made the reservation. All the rooms were booked on the orcid floor so they could not move us their so they ended up moving us to the top floor one bedroom which was a beautiful room it was very nice of them to upgrade us other wise we probly wouldnt have come back. The food we had for room services was good rooms was very clean and aveda products are a great choice could use full length mirrors in the room though. Staff very helpfull and freindly they held out lugage for half they day after we checked out. The breakfast buffett we had with our room rate was a good value and they kept it well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sugus54
Reviews.Content: Very professional staff > very helpful and friendly. Perfect service from breakfast to bedtime. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Atmosphere-Downtown Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jukebo1x
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month we stayed at the Lovely Georgian Court Hotel. It is very nicely located on Beatty near Robson. . The atmosphere of this boutique hotel is warm. We were greeted by pleasant employees who wanted to share their lovely city with us. Our large clean room contained a king bed. The nice sized bathroom contained a vanity that traveled the length of the room. There was plenty of closet space, containing slippers, an umbrella, and a robe. The business center contained two PC's. This was helpful for printing boarding passes and catching up on emails. The hotel offers complimentary bottled water and apples. Frankie's Italian Kitchen, next door was a terrifiic place to watch the Stanley Cup! The hotel is located across from BC Place Stadium and close to Rogers Arena. It is walking distance to public bus service heading to and from Stanley Park and an Aquabus Ferry service heading to and from Granville Island. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping close by. All in all, this is our new favorite Vancouver hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fall over yourself to stay here”
Reviews.Author: NikkiGats
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have had it any better. The Georgian Court was a fantastic place to stay for our few days in Vancouver recently. We were there during the madness of the Stanley cup and although the hotel was chocca, we were treated like royalty. The staff were really attentive and Paul, the main guy on reception is absolutely something else. He helped us with restaurants, hiring a car to go white water rafting and even gave us a fabulous upgrade when he realised we'd recently got married. The sports bar of the hotel was the perfect venue to watch the game in comfort, to then go out into the street when the Vancouver Canucks won against Boston, to celebrate with the rest of the city. Despite the fact that the city is renovating the stadium opposite the hotel, we didn't experience any disturbance, it may not look it's best, but you only have to go round the corner and down to the harbour to see the most beautiful city. Honestly, fall over yourself to say here, and if you do, say 'Hi' to Paul from Nikki & Neale - the man is a legend.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigirl59
Reviews.Content: Two problems. First: the unrelenting noise I endured for four days. There is 24/7 construction noise from across the road (banging and grinding). Then screaming, tooting and the odd fog horn from the ice hocky fans ( followed by "Ultimate Fighting" fans), and also a bar/nightclub down the road with their thump, thump, thump till the wee small hours. Which was puzzleing because I was on the 7th floor and there was double-glazing. It took me three days to work out that the window seal is damaged, so it was like haveing the window slightly open, all the time. If you need sleep, don't stay in room 717. Second: the customer service were horrible to me. I made the fatal mistake of asking about "public transport". From then on, they treated me like Julia Roberts in the movie Pretty Woman. The scene where she goes into a ritzy Beverly Hills store to buy a dress, and they treat her with scorn and contempt. Unfortunatly I didn't have Richard Geer to come to my aid. Now I'm no bag-lady, hooker, drunk or junkie. But they sure made me feel that way.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: msbl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the orchid suites. The orchid suites are designed for the female traveler. The room was awesome. It had a hair straightener, curling iron, blow dryer, nail polish remover and aveda products. The hotel was old but nicely remodeled with a modern design. The housekeeping was wonderful. I called to use the microwave and they put one in my room while I was out . The only bad part of the hotel is the elevator and the bathroom . The elevator kept taking us to the basement and the bathroom did not have a vent. I enjoyed my stay there. The hotel is so close to the best waffle place in town- Cafe Medina.

Reviews.Title: “Highly professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Junkroom
Reviews.Content: Well trained staff who were naturally friendly in an unforced manner made this an excellent stay. Desk staff, waiters and managers alike were all adept at hitting the right tone and balancing friendliness with efficiency. The room was excellent, as was breakfast. Of the hotel facilities, we used only the business suite for checking emails and contacting family, all free and available 24 hrs. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from busy Yaletown, with many options for public transport. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “If Vancouver again then Georgian Court again.”
Reviews.Author: stuart38
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights pre Alaska cruise. Slighty odd location as mentioned by others. Lobby entrance directly on the street and not obvious. Once inside, though everything was extremely good. Staff at reception very helpful. Room exceptional though not with a great view - to be expected with this sort of central location. We didn't eat there but reception pointed us towards the restaurant area of the city a few blocks away - see my 'Global' restaurant review. Would stay there again when/or if we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy bed! Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Allisonr30
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Georgian Court in May 2011. The staff were very friendly on greating us and helped us find some late night food places nearby. The rooms were lovely with a very comfy bed and great bathroom! Only downfall was the noise to be heard from other rooms through the walls and the construction going on all night over the road at the stadium. The hotel was close to the city, with a leisurely 10 min walk to get there. We will definately stay again- with ear plugs- if we make it back to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - so so B&B”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim-tabibito
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to attend a concert at Rogers Arena. It was in walking distance. We bought the Bed and Breakfast package. The breakfasts were good but a little boring. Since we were staying there 3 nights we had the same breakfast 3 days in a row (sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs, fruit). Next time I'd just get the breakfast one day and go somewhere else for the rest of the days just to get a little variety. It would have been nice if they did something a little different each day (e.g. pancakes, french toast, waffles) like many other B&Bs. The 'shuttle' service is only a shuttle downtown locations and NOT the airport. It makes me wonder why they ask for airplane flight numbers - arrival and departure times on their web reservation system...a bit deceptive. Overall we'd stay here again but probably not pay the extra bed and breakfast fee. Probably one of the best places we've stayed at in Vancouver so far.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: RelaxMeToronto
Reviews.Content: I have slept on beds in Cuba that were softer than at this hotel. So hard I had to double fold the duvet and sleep on top to have a bit of comfort. The little sign left on my bed said I have been given a choice of firm or soft pillows - there were no firm pillows - asked for one but it wasnt really firm either. The phone in my room said it was Room 313 when in fact I was in room 315. Took me awhile to realize (when I called room service) that this was wrong (I had left my room number for numerous people and was wondering why I was not getting any calls) Emailed the customer service rep about this and have yet to hear back (3 days later) Also wireless internet didnt work so well - kept getting knocked off. First day there the internet was down most of the afternoon/evening. So much for their "LEGENDARY" service. NEXT!!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris82255060
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8.30am from our Alaskan Cruise thinking we would just have to leave our luggage for at least 6 hours to find our room was available. This was so good. The free business centre with use of internet was great after paying quite a bit for internet use at the Fairmont Hotels over the last 2 weeks! Location was good, access to Robson Street, Gas Town and China town within easy walking disance. We would recommend this hotel to any Australians looking for a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: KentishMaid52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel both pre- and post- a cruise to Alaska. Reception staff were welcoming and helpful at all times and very knowledgeable when asked for recommendations for restaurants, or the cost of taxi journeys. Rooms were spotlessly clean and the beds were soooooooo comfortable! A quiet neighbourhood, within walking distance of the pick-up point for the hop-on, hop-off bus/trolley city tours, and also close to other sightseeing 'musts'. Breakfast in the linked restaurant was very good value and plentiful. Definitely a good choice if you want - as we did - to be somewhere different from the high-rise hotels in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “I found my Vancouver hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CandacePharm
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel online and was impressed with their rates compared to others in the area. I was absolutely blown away upon arrival. The location is amazing, being a block from Robson and a few blocks from all the shops and restaurants in Yaletown. The rooms were clean and beds very comfortable. I was most impressed by the staff-- in particular, Dan. They took care of us, got to know us and sold us on this hotel for all our future stays. I have found my hotel in Vancouver that I will always stay at and look forward to coming to!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a few times, a bit noisy right now”
Reviews.Author: PaulSHarris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here a few time now, and myself I have stayed here going back to the 80's, as per usual I have always enjoyed this place it is reasonable and convenient to everything one needs in Vancouver. It does show it's age a bit, but makes up for that in service. The only problem this time was the noise coming from construction across the street at B.C. Place. Maybe I should have taken it into consideration that there would be noise but we were also not warned of this inconvenience, a room on the back side of the hotel would be better until later this fall of 2011 as the construction will be ongoing till then. But over all good stay, good rates including breakfast, but request a room on the back side or bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Guest_Services_STIGR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georgian Court Hotel for a mini vacation and could have not chosen a better hotel! The rooms were spotless and service amazing and the staff always friendly going that extra mile to ensure you have everything you need. The room was perfect with fridge, bathrobe, super comfortable bed, couch and an amazing view of BC Pace. With the super central location it took us only a short walk to shopping, restaurants and night life - and Rogers Arena. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Leann1988
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Georgian Court while visiting Vancouver to see Cavalia. The location is VERY close to BC Place and Rogers Arena. No need to take a cab or shuttle to these places. The hotel was clean and the staff was courteous. Our room was basic with two queens that were triple sheeted (a big plus!). We purchased the "Bed & Breakfast" package which intitles us to breakfast in their restaurant. However, after arriving, the restaurant was closed for remodeling until April. Our free breakfast was in a conference room with just eggs, potatoes, breakfast meats, toast, muffins, fruit and cereal. It was OK but, not the "valued at $20.95" as mentioned on the website. Also, Beatty's Bar & Grill is only open on weekends and concert event nights during remodeling. So, if you are there during the week, make other plans. Underground parking is available and secure. You access the garage with your room key. Valet is $30 and self-park is $16. I would recommend staying in a room that does not face BC Place. They are fixing the roof of BC Place through September and work all night. Not the hotel's fault but, avoidable. If I ever attend another Vancouver concert, I will definitely keep the Georgian on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel when visiting sports arenas”
Reviews.Author: catarra
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Georgian Court Hotel for one night while in town for a Vancouver Canucks game. Having stayed at two other nearby hotels (Rosedale on Robson and Sandman) while in town for hockey games, this hotel is by far the best for its location and value. I booked a room on the Orchid Floor, which caters to women. My understanding is that a woman must book the room, but there was no issue with my boyfriend staying in the room. Orchid Floor rooms have additional amenities (curling iron, flat iron, fashion magazines, yoga mat, etc.) that would generally appeal to women. Rooms were very comfortable and clean. Front desk staff was adequate. Friendly, but nothing special. We spent some time in the hotel's bar prior to the game and were pleasantly surprised. The bar was a bit dead/quiet when we first arrived, and the menu didn't seem to have much depth (both food and beer). We were very happy to discover the nachos (try them!) and some new microbrews. Location to Rogers Arena is perfect. A quick walk and you are in your seat. The room I booked included the breakfast buffet. I assumed it was in a restaurant when I booked, but it is actually a room set-up just for the breakfast buffet. We were not impressed with the selection or quality. In the future, I would skip the buffet and head to one of the nearby restaurants. The hotel does have a steamroom, although we were not able to enjoy it as it closed before we returned from the hockey game. Parking is easy (underground garage) and fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Raving fan and wow service!”
Reviews.Author: LisaErickson
Reviews.Content: This last Saturday; March 12th I arrived at the Georgian Court Hotel on crutches due to a surgery I had a few weeks ago. I was traveling by myself since really wanted to go to a conference and the hotel staff went out of their way to help me including arranging transportation to/from the event location. In addition to this the hotel was wonderful and comfortable with ammentities. would highly recommend this to friends/family traveling to Vancouver BC.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Aeolus3040
Reviews.Content: Next to the Hockey arena and walking distance to China Town and Yaletown, this hotel is conveniently situated. The staff could not be friendlier or more helpful.We had two visits so experienced two rooms both were quiet and comfortable. If I come to Vancouver again I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracystoick
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 7 year old son came to Vancouver to see the Boston Bruins play at Rogers Arena. We chose this hotel based on location to arena and the reviews posted here. We were not disappointed. Walked down to the Aquabus dock in Yaletown and took the water shuttle over to Granville Island. Great place to visit, even with kids, since it has it's own Kids Market. Went back both days. Rogers Arena is a easy walk away with lots of resturants close by on Robson Street. They only bad would be that the choice between a king bed and two doubles was a little surprising. We are not large adults but it was not comfortable for two adults to sleep in a double bed. In other words maybe two queens should be offered.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Canadoc
Reviews.Content: I took my teenaged daughter to a Canucks game and wanted something close by. I had a great deal of trouble finding it because of all of the odd angled roads, construction, one way roads etc. And that was with two maps! Underground parking at the hotel. Check in was a bit slow with only one active clerk but he was very friendly and helpful. I picked a room on the Orchid Floor for my mother/daughter night out. The website doesn't say the floor is only for women. Men are there too. There are just those extra perks for the ladies. It made the stay just that little bit more fun. The cost was the same. It is on the 10th floor out of 12. The room was very nice. Very upscale. Lots of pillows and a lovely duvet. TV is big although reception a bit blurry. We had a view of other buildings. Oh well. I didn't give the best rating for location. In terms of the sports stadiums it is perfect. Lots of street people around though. This can be quite disturbing to a 14 year old girl out walking at night. One elevator was broken so we had to wait in a long line of people who all came back from the game. No one could find stairs going up. I didn't bother to ask the staff since I wasn't walking 10 flights of stairs. I am not sure how other patrons felt about a crowd of noisy people going down the halls after a hockey game. We tried to be quiet. Lovely sleep. Then room service breakfast which was fast and good. Not a lot of choice but I think they are renovating the kitchen. Check out was fine. I mentioned that my daughter wanted to buy the slippers from the room and they gave them to her for free. Very nice. I will definitely stay again when I go to a hockey game.22

Reviews.Title: “More than surpassed my every expectation!”
Reviews.Author: winnipeg1950
Reviews.Content: Staff that cater to your every need to make you feel that you are the most important guest. Beds that are absolutely dreamy..best sleep ever. Best decision I made was to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jojo1015
Reviews.Content: It looks pretty small, but our room was pretty big size and staff were very friendly. If you are looking for a hotel near GM place, I totally recommend this hotel for sure. But if you are looking for a hotel right in the middle of Robson (shopping area), no problem but it might be 10 mins walk. As there are many restaurants or a lot of entertaiment in Vancouver downtown, 10 mins walk would be a second walking. Also, FYI, they have pet friendly floors. However, they have cat friendly floor and dog's separately. So, it might be very limited. Enjoy your stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed downtown for Company Christmas party”
Reviews.Author: nonnynunu
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay in this hotel last weekend while staying downtown for a company Christmas party. The front desk staff were very courteous and friendly and check in was very quick. They were very knowlegable about the surrounding area and helped us with our questions about getting around. Our room was on the 8th floor and we found it to be very clean and inviting. The bed was by far the most comfortable we have ever slept in. I just loved the comfy duvet and pillows. The finishing touches were also nice. We like having a fridge in our room along with complimentary water. In the lobby there was also complimentary water, apples and newspapers. I can't wait to have another opportunity to stay downtown and this will be my hotel of choice. Thank you again for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!! PUSHING 30.. WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND!!”
Reviews.Author: Roonie76
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with 2 girlfriends to follow the new drinking and driving laws. We got into room at about 330am after attending dinner and a concert. As we were lying in our beds sleeping. Security knocked on our door telling us that we had to leave and that they would escort us from the room and out of the building because they received a noise complaint. No warnings or anything. This was at 5am! Except for the long walk down to our room at the very end of the hallway, would be the only noise we agree to.. Did they want us to tip toe to our room? There are no CD players or IPOD docks in the room and the TV was off, so aside from recapping the night with a few giggles, I find it hard to believe we were making that kind of noise. I am almost concerned if their walls are made out of paper mache.. We have all traveled together before and this was by far the WORSE hotel experience of our lives. The security were so adamant that they be able to go into our room to ensure there were only 3 occupants. It was us 3 ladies who were all in our pajamas and privacy completely INVADED!! They walked around and were absolutely rude and invasive! This was apparently an all women floor (The Orchid Floor) and we were led to believe that it was. While discussing options outside of our room with security, a MAN in an adjacent room opened his door and asked us to keep it down. If anyone is to blame for the noise, it would be how the night time concierge handled this whole situation. He executed such POOR hospitality and customer service that it has turned what had been a great night to an absolutely horrible nightmare!! We are grown women and not a bunch of teenagers, treated so unfairly! Two of us are mothers who were seeking refuge in a mini weekend getaway from home.. Only to find ourselves more tired than if we had just gone home and woken up to our children in the morning!! None of us were being rude, we only questioned the basis of their reason to remove three women out of their room at 5am! To add insult to injury they called the police (how embarrassing!), when the police showed up at our door they were much more pleasant to talk to than security or front desk! They even apologized for having to do this call and thanked us for following the new drinking and driving laws and told us to go back to sleep! We only wished that they were there from the get go because it was obvious who knew how to do their job and who didn't!! If you are in Vancouver for a concert, game or anything that involves a fun weekend: DO NOT CHOOSE THIS HOTEL!! You will regret it as much as we do!! Side note: Bathroom is outdated. You literally have no room to bend and the toilet is questionable! Vanity is way too small, which had the only sink so if one were to wash their hands the person using the mirror had to move. We had switched rooms which we also regret because there was really nothing to their suite and the pull out bed was just AWFUL!! My back is a mess because of it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, convenience and cost effective!”
Reviews.Author: NG_VanTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their suites, which was spacious, impeccably clean, comfortable and was more than enough room for three of us. The Georgian Court is smaller than some of its downtown competitors and this works to its advantage because the front desk staff recognize their guests. The hotel lobby has lovely decor and this is echoed throughout the rest of the hotel. The bathrooms by the business room are amazing! The chocolates left on the bed were just what the doctor ordered at 8am the next day and was the perfect finish to a fantastic night's sleep! The beds are very comfortable here and the bathrooms are filled with Aveda products. Enough said. If you're looking for quality that won't rob your wallet, the Georgian Court is an excellent choice. The breakfast the next morning was great too!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LittleG2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our holiday. The room was very spacious and comfortable with 2 double beds and there was a selection of toiletries in the bathroom. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant every day - there was a choice of a fixed price buffet or you could order hot food from the menu. The prices were reasonable and the food was nice. The hotel was in a good location. We got there from the airport easily via the Sky Train and a lot of the main Vancouver attractions were within walking distance. The nearest Sky Train station is a short walk away. We booked the free hotel shuttle bus and the reception staff were very helpful. There was free water and available every day for hotel guests. If we return to Vancouver then we would book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies only floor - love it!”
Reviews.Author: happynorthshoregal
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights with a colleague and we were on the ladies only floor - what a concept. In the rooms they thought of everything - not only hair dryers but flat irons and curling irons too. Also tucked away in the closet was a box with the essentials (sewing kit and nylons to name a few items). I will definately be referring this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jenn155019
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights while on vacation in Vancouver. From the second we stepped in we had fantastic service (with the big exception of someone at the front desk named Paul). Everyone was so friendly right down to the maids and managers that we passed in the hall. Complimentary chocolates were given on arrival and duplicated when we jokingly mentioned how much we liked them! The location was also great, very central and their complimentary shuttle service made it very easy for my family (my father partly disabled) to get around. Although the hotel may not have the view others in Vancouver boast of, it was the perfect relaxing end to our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: cheeko145
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with family members ( we were in the city for a wedding) and we had a spectacular stay! It was a very visually appealing hotel. Room service was awesome, the restaurant had a wide selection of great tasting food and the staff at the front desk were always pleasant and great to deal with. The thing I enjoyed most was the location, it was great walking distance to everywhere I wanted to go, I would recommend this to hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Visit”
Reviews.Author: staceysullivan
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience during our stay at the Georgian Court. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff wea very friendly, helpful and attentive when ever they were needed.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever”
Reviews.Author: fiddlechickpatt
Reviews.Content: I love the bed! From the moment I laid eyes on the down comforter stretched across the king sized bed and the mountain of cushy pillows, I couldn't wait to crawl in to bed come evening. It did not disappoint. I hunkered down for a great sleep, and a great sleep it was. I was actually disappointed when it was morning! I don't know that I moved position all night! The staff at the front desk were incredibly accommodating. I don't know what other hotels do when you check in but it seems to take forever before getting your key and heading up to your room. At the Georgian Court it literally took less than 5 minutes from the time I walked in the door to opening my room. I also loved the Aveda products in the bathroom! How luxurious! The breakfast buffet the next morning was to die for and at when I called down to ask for a late check out, I was accommodated instantly and easily. I have never stayed at this hotel before and definitely will again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: DCBLEGAL
Reviews.Content: This was by far and away the best value hotel in Vancouver when i was looking at start of Oct. . On check in was upgraded to a suite (not quite as glamourous as it sounds but very comfortable, with separate living / desk area. If I were to be picky, the shower/bath section looked a little tired, the wireless internet could be very slow (but hey, its free) and the breakfast served downstairs was Ok but not great. The staff are very friendly and the location handy(C$8 cab ride to the Convention Centre) for example; shopping district close. Would certainly stay again. Recommend potential guests join the Small Luxury Hotels of the World club [www.slh.com] to access the discounted offer rates / upgraded benefits here.
