Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and a great location”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRetirees54
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be exceptional and friendly from the front desk to the housekeeping staff . Great location easy walking distance to waterfront and local theatres as well as sporting events.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fergo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there only last week on 2nd week of our honeymoon. Its well positioned, just off Robson Street. The hotel amenities are excellent. Take out the hotel bicycles (max 3hrs). Then do the harbour wall route. Well worth it. The Bar & Grill next door is very good. Very friendly staff & reasonable prices. A full week was probably a bit too long for us, as we'd seen everything we wanted to see in 5 days. But cant fault the hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lokabrenna
Reviews.Content: Amenities: Aveda products, robe, bar fridge, coffee stand (with real cream), safe, desk, steam room and whirl pool, restaurant(s)... nice linens, good lighting, good towels, all around good. Stayed facing the alley, very quiet except for the ventilation system of another building (however the window open for airflow)...up that high we had a great urban view at night. great staff, clean place...modern enough, cosy enough. Even an armed robbery caught one night...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theatregirl1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georgian Court for four days at the start of our two week stay in British Columbia and got a really good deal through expedia . The location of the hotel was great and we walked everywhere - it took about 20 minutes to walk to the waterfront, and 10 minutes to Yaletown. The hotel itself was clean and roomy and the staff were friendly and helpful, although the free bikes were being services while we were there which was a shame. The only strange thing was that both lifts open their doors before reaching the floor. Slightly unnerving! I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a good base to explore downtown.

Reviews.Title: “We had a really great stay at this lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Annaventure43
Reviews.Content: We really liked everything about this hotel. We shouldn't have stayed there as it was over our budget but compared to all the cheaper hotels this wasn't too much more for what we got. The gym had up to date equipment and we had a great work out, the room was really lovely with great complimentary bathroom products. There is an all female floor with extras too which sounded great but i was with my husband. The location was central enough for us as we walk a lot (rare seemingly) but they do have a great shuttle service around the centre if you need it. The decor was lovely and modern but classy, the breakfast buffet was exactly what we wanted - and i never say that. The underground parking felt secure and the staff were all really friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is truly the hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: italianlavender
Reviews.Content: There are simply too many things that went wrong during my stay with this dubious hotel. From being insulted by a waiter when I couldn't read the menu dur to a vision impairment to the toilet flooding 2 times in the first room, and one in the second room I asked to be transferred to. They actually had to replace the whole toilet and it leaked onto the carpet, and we were having to walk on wet carpet. Either the place is haunted of it needs a major reno. It was cold at night when the manager set the temperature too low for the entire building, and too hot during the day with many guests complaining. For some reason the electronic keys wouldn't work in the lifts for many guests and I saw many guests complaining. The area is completely dodgy with addicts around, and pan handlers everywhere. The sirens are going all night, and it is not safe to go out after dark with out being in a big group.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BethanyHall
Reviews.Content: The waterfront hotels were too expensive for our 2 day stay in Vancouver, so our travel agent recommended the Georgian Court. I hadn't heard of it and was expecting very little. Wrong! They take service seriously in this hotel! we couldn't fault them. The rooms were good; the beds huge; the pillows many and the sleep good. The location is great too. Breakfast has lots of options. But it's the staff who are the stars. front desk and concierge were just great. If you want to know about restaurants ask paulo or the lovely Daniel; both helpful lovely guys. Thanks Brian at All Seasons!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLKTL
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Georgian Court Hotel for a few nights in July. There are a couple of good restaurants nearby and would definitely recommend the Chophouse which is just across the street. As for the hotel: the staff were really friendly, the rooms were comfy, to a good standard and very clean. Parking is available. Downtown isn't far to walk (though is uphill). Would happily recommend. The free WiFi is a huge plus!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel, superior service”
Reviews.Author: SeaTrav10
Reviews.Content: The Georgian Court is a wonderful boutique hotel. It's located near concert and sports venues in Yaletown, a short walk to the Aquabus to Granville Island and one block from Robson Street (15 minutes on foot to the retail core). It's a little older, but the rooms are clean and spacious. The staff is courteous and knowledgeable about the area. The hotel offers free bottled water in the rooms and downstairs, Aveda bath products, and other amenities. There is a small complimentary shuttle - the one time we asked, it was full (but that was at dinnertime on Saturday, so no surprise). Parking is affordable for a hotel at $16/day. We ate breakfast in the restaurant, which was tasty and surprisingly affordable. I've stayed in a lot of hotels, many of which are rated highly but have poor service and charge you through the nose for all of the extras. The Georgian Court deserves high marks and I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great individual hotel with an exceptionally warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Vicster111
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. It is a great location for downtown in the day and nice meals out in Yaletown in the evening. The kids absolutely loved their breakfast pancakes! The staff were really welcoming and helpful, giving tips and suggestions for our stay as soon as we arrived. The complimentary downtown shuttle service was really helpful for getting us to locations at no additional cost. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Good Location and a great value through travelocity”
Reviews.Author: greaume
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in early August. Pro's - Had access to 4 (one was broken) free bikes that folks could sign out. A nice way to see Vancouver is by bike along the seawall. - Nice spacious rooms. They gave us a free cot for one of our teens. - Location would be excellent if you were going to hockey or football game. Not as good for stanley park as it's on the otherside of downtown. There is a free shuttle though which made up for it. Con's - Not sure if all hotels are like this there but we heard a lot of seagulls early in the morning. - Location as mentioned above if you are more interested in Stanley Park. - No pool but a nice hot tub and wet sauna. - If you paid full price (about $200 / night) that would have been too expensive. We got a deal through Expedia or Travelocity at about $119 a night which was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fair 4 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiKeyWest
Reviews.Content: Nice place, very friendly & helpful staff, fair location, good price value.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nelsons1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed after a cruise and we were tired.The hotel offered everthing we needed. Great bed, good food and location. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions. Enjoyed our stay and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Carlota888
Reviews.Content: A perfect place! I really enjoyed my stay here... I was well located and the room had every thing one could need...

Reviews.Title: “Special treats in store for women travellers”
Reviews.Author: janem25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. We made the booking in person, and the receptionist at the time told us she'd upgraded us to the ladies' floor, where there were additional amenities for women. The room was spacious and comfortable, and we certainly appreciated the additional features, but it seems a pity that they're only available for women travelling without their male partners. We were very comfortable in our room, and it was very good value for money, with breakfast included. The location was also excellent, being just round the corner from Robson Street with its great restaurants/cafes and excellent shopping. The hop on/hop off bus stops right outside, which is also very convenient, and there seems to be a taxi stand right outside so we had no trouble getting to the airport on time. The hotel also has a free shuttle service for guests till 7pm which would be particularly useful for first time visitors to Vancouver. I hope I get the chance to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tabdulla
Reviews.Content: I think it was a great hotel.... the only thing was that when I got there in a limo I was expecting a bell boy or someone to help me with my bags which one by one I had to carry into the hotel and then after checking in they helped me take them up. the staff was nice enough to show me two rooms which I could choose from... the bathroom and amenities were great.... could do with a little more lighting in the bathtub area, Nice location and for the price I got it from hotwire for was just awesome. and yes there was free wifi access... BUT it could have been faster...it was really very very slow

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel With Lots of Class”
Reviews.Author: SusieQL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this boutique hotel while waiting to board the Rocky Mountaineer Train. Never having been to Vancouver before, we weren't sure what to expect from a small hotel. We were both delighted to find that it was classy and well managed. We were greeted out front upon our arrival and check-in was easy. The rooms were roomy, mattress very comfortable, the sheets were of high quality, towels were oversized and the bathroom was stocked with Aveda products. Another thing I was delighted with was that the tub was deep, wide and not fiberglass. Several water bottles were in the room at no extra charge and internet access was free. Water bottles are also available at the front desk for the taking which is great for sightseeing. A newspaper in a cloth sack was hung on our door each morning. The daytime staff was very knowledgeable about what bus stops, water taxis or walking routes to take to various sites, and they will provide you a city map. There are three restaurants: a grill, a bistro and fine dining. We ate in the Bistro for both a breakfast and one evening meal; both meals were excellent, but we thought a bit overpriced (until we ate elsewhere and discovered all of Vancouver is expensive). They make their own ice cream and the pistachio was to die for. The hotel provides a free shuttle during some hours of the day, but I would suggest that you make a reservation to use it, especially around dinner time, as may already be booked. The Georgian Court is within walking distance of the Yaletown, Chinatown and Gastown sections of the city. The Seabus from Granville Island can be picked up in Yaletown which is about an 8 minute walk. Dr. Sun Yat Sen's Garden is also within walking distance and from there you can pick up the #19 bus to Stanley Park ($1.50) or to the boat launch area for a harbor cruise. We enjoyed our stay there very much and have decided that when we go back to Vancouver we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: robotkin
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for enjoying the city, very central and fairly priced. Take advantage of the free bicycles provided by the hotel and ride the 5+ mile seawall trail the whole way around Stanley Park, its amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: tangojo
Reviews.Content: I can't find fault with this hotel at all. The beds are to die for and the rooms well appointed. It's a short walk to Granville and within easy access to almost anything. The views aren't exactly riveting, but you get that with most city based hotels. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again in a heartbeat. It's location is perfect if you are attending an event at either BC Place or the GM Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice boutique hotel feeling”
Reviews.Author: Pounette166
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georgian Court for 2 nights, following the end of an Alaska cruise. Hotel is about 10 min max from cruise port and taxi cost about $10. Really nice and quiet location although I agree with some of the other reviews that it is not located that close to restaurant. Nonetheless, the metro or bus are right there and if you want to walk even just 5-10 minutes, you will find plenty of places to go. We walked from the hotel to Stanley Park entrance and then all over Stanley Park and came back at the hotel. It is a beautiful walk all around, especially the marina side. We had a suite in the hotel at a really really good price of $168 per night (plus tax) and that included a very healthy buffet breakfast. We arrived at about 11:00am and Daniel, at the front desk was more than helpful and manage to get us in our corner suite right away. Talk about great service. The hotel has a night-turndown service and they place chocolate on your pillow. Very nice and tasteful. The suite was truly beautiful and big, with mini-fridge, big TV, computer desk, dining table and free wireless internet. There is a gym on site with one or two treadmill (I can't recall), an elleptical and a bike. Looks nice and clean although we did not use. There is a hot tub and steam sauna, we used them both and found it very nice and relaxing., There are bathroom and shower available right beside the sauna and hot tub - which was very convenient. The only negative I would have to say, is the we found out on our last day that the hotel provided, free of charge, bike to guest. If we would have known that, we would have taken advantage of it, as they look like very good and comfy bike. But otherwise, we were more than pleased with the hotel, the amenities, location, breakfast included at the William Tell beside and overall staff attitude - which was very nice, professional and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel and I will use it again, when traveling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: ON-THE-WAY-OUT
Reviews.Content: The Georgian Court definitely deserves an updated review that reflect the completion of the remodel and the current staff. The service at this hotel is outstanding. We were met with someone to help unload our bags from the cab, check us in quickly and efficiently and then serve as concierge, recommending best ways to see the city and nearby restaurants. The room was large, clean and pleasantly decorated and included a lovely view of downtown VanCouver. The Big Red Tour Bus, a definitely great way to see VanCouver, stops in front of the hotel. I would rank this a 5 on the basis of how it served our needs. Only two drawbacks: it is in Yaletown and most restaurants are in other areas, although those areas can be walked or reached by a short cab ride, and they do not provide a breakfast, but fast breakfast places are less than a three minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: okgirlatheart
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights for a Canucks game and the Eagles concert. We were impressed with the overall service, and cleanliness of the hotel. I must say...the most comfortable hotel bed we have slept on! Our room was amply large enough and very quiet. The location is perfect for events at GM Place. In our opinion, no other place to stay in downtown Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: GTHPTraveler
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend stay, very good meal at the restaurant, walking distance to most everything downtown, Yaletown, shopping & entertainment. The staff were very friendly and very helpful. We'll be back there for our next weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Great except....”
Reviews.Author: sircalypso
Reviews.Content: The Georgian Court is a nice, older boutique hotel. The service was great and very friendly. Some of the staff need to be a bit more knowledgable about the surrounding area, but overall very helpful. The steam room and whirlpool was a nice added bonus. So everything was great except, for some reason after the first night i stayed there, I would get an itchy rash at while I was sleeping. Don't know if it was the bedding (they said they would check) or maybe it was a reaction to the Aveeda products in the room. Nevertheless....very annoying!!! The rooms seemed clean, but I don't know if something else was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, good location”
Reviews.Author: andycrosson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while visiting a prospective employer in Vancouver just before the Olympics started. The company covered the cost of the accommodation so I cant comment on the value of the hotel but the food was good value and quality in the bistro bar and adjacent sports bar. The hotel is located directly opposite BC Place and is handy for Robson St, Canucks hockey and city centre shopping. the stadium skytrain station is two blocks away and Yaletown is a few blocks walk away. A trolley bus city tour service stops right outside the hotel and the hotel offers a free shuttle service to anywhere in downtown Vancouver. I stayed in a suite on the 8th floor, the room was very nice with comfy bed and nice bathroom, the hotel provides free wireless and wired internet and a flat screen TV is provided in the living area and bedroom. There is a coffee machine and tea making facilities plus free water in the room. Service at the front desk and bars / restaurants was always very good. The hotel has a jacuzzi, steam room and small gym which were nice after a hard days sightseeing / interviews - particularly after snowboarding at Grouse Mountain. I would recommend this hotel to business travellers and anybody who is looking for a good quality hotel with access to most of the sights

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Gizzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Georgian Court for its proximity to GM place, and based on reviews on tripadvisor. We were very happy with our decision. The hotel was very nice, although the beds/room a little small, but very comfy beds, nice TV, bathroom, etc. The front desk was very helpful as well for any questions, cabs were always available at the lobby, and the umbrella (and safe) in the closet were unexpected, yet appreciated. Was a quick, easy walk to shopping on Robson Street and we felt very safe walking around shopping, and to/from GM Place at night. Aside from all the rain, we enjoyed our time in Vancouver, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend Georgian Court.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel7779
Reviews.Content: Came up to Vancouver from the states for a one night stay to see a show at the Queen Elizabeth Center with my 18 yr old son. We were nervous since we don't know our way around the city, but found the hotel's location to the venue was excellent, and only a few blocks to walk. We felt perfectly safe at the hotel and surrounding area. The staff was friendly and helpful. When we checked in we simply drove up to the secured parking garage, they welcomed us, opened the gate, we parked, and took our bags to the front desk and checked in. Didn't have to check in first, then park. The hotel is beautiful, very elegant. I will post the pics I took. The room was perfectly appointed, and as everyone says, the beds ARE very comfortable. The only things I could find as a "negative" which to us wasn't but to some might be, is the hotel doesn't have magnificent views. We were on the 9th floor, facing south. The north facing rooms face the large stadium. However, that wasn't important to us as we didn't spend much time in the room. They were very quiet, however, and clean, clean, clean. Bathrooms were adequate, nice coffeemaker in the bathroom. The tv was the biggest I've seen in a standard room. Nice widescreen tv. We were unable to check out the restaurants at the hotel due to no time, but we ordered pizza delivery at 12:30am after the show, and were pleased that the hotel checked with us before allowing the pizza deliveryman to come up to the room. Good security. We had a great time, and I look forward to coming back to stay here in April with my husband to see an NHL game, which is also conveniently located just across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Handy and affordable. But that says it.”
Reviews.Author: Woodyinthemiddle
Reviews.Content: This was a very handy hotel which our next day tour would agree to pick up at. The neighbourhood was very ordinary in our opinion. If we had more money, we would have stayed a few blocks up. The staff were curt, to say the least. But the place is busy, the rooms are clean and it serverd our purpose. The restaurants (2) were over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: northernstar30
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner checked into the Georgian Court Hotel as we wanted to stay somewhere close to GM Place for the concert we were attending - the hotel was literally a stone's throw away. The reception we got was great - extremely helpful, pleasant and courteous. We even got a free room upgrade without asking which was pretty neat! Parking at the hotel was $13 (which we also got free!!). The room was spacious and well appointed, and the bed was extremely comfy. Good choice of breakfast, and once again, very courteous, helpful staff. We'd most definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful front desk staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: kencat
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at this hotel recently and was very impressed. The beds were very comfortable, and the room was clean and attractive. This hotel is within walking distance to shopping areas and restaurants, and the art gallery. There is also a hot tub and steam room which were an added bonus. The best thing about this hotel was how friendly and helpful the staff were in recommending restaurants and activities for visitors who were new to Vancouver. The price was very reasonable, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Georgian in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: JourneyJen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June 2009 and was quite pleased. It is convenient to downtown shopping, restaurants and arenas. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The Hotel's staff seemed to go out of their way to provide assistance, whether it was offering recommendations or directions to local attractions. At the time of my stay, the Hotel was in the midst of major renovations. However, the resulting noise did not prove to be an issue. My only complaint is that the internet service was somewhat unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lycheeice
Reviews.Content: We drove into Vancouver from Seattle and had to paid an extra 13 dollars per night for parking. Not a bad deal considering there's hardly any free street parking around, and you can take the car in/out as many time as you want. Most of the time we just left the car in the garage and walked around town. The renovation for the lobby is done, and it is elegant yet modern. The room we stayed in was very nice and the bed was comfortable. We mostly ate out so didn't try the restaurant in the hotel. We went to the gym and the equipments are in good shape. We also used the steam room and whirlpool, and since we were the only one there at the time, it definitely has the exclusive spa feel to it. There was one funny incident at the hotel though. Two guys took the hotel lounge chairs and put them in the elevator and started drinking in the elevator. We took a ride up with them. They were odd but friendly, so no harm done.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the dicounted price.”
Reviews.Author: biker367
Reviews.Content: I got a deal on this room but I would never pay their normal rate to stay here. The bed is comfortable and rooms are clean and quite. No breakfast included which was suprising because of the price. I did not travel with my laptop this time but the front desk staff told me there are computers available in the office center. Great location for events and for the restaurants in Yaletown. I would stay again but would pay no more than $170.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: acon234
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in early July. Very nice hotel, great location, reasonable rates. We checked into our room and the guest who stayed in that room before us must have been smoking in the room (it is a non-smoking hotel). No fault of the hotel's, we called down to the front desk, someone was up to our room to check it out within minutes and since they had no other similar rooms available they immediately gave us a suite. That's the kind of service that makes people remember your hotel and keep coming back. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Vancouver stay”
Reviews.Author: skagittraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for an overnight trip to Vancouver. Traveled by Amtrak from near Seattle. The hotel renovations are almost complete. The staff was remarkably helpful. We got a great rate through a booking service. The location is convenient to Yaletown, Gastown, Chinatown, and Robson shopping. False Creek's water taxi is nearby as is transit to anywhere in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel once you get out of the lobby”
Reviews.Author: lawgirlvt
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very pleased with the Georgian Court, but it should be noted that they are currently undergoing some pretty serious renovations in the lobby and on some of the floors. The service was outstanding, with friendly, knowledgeable staff at the front desk and in the restaurants. The room was very nice, with incredibly comfortable beds and nice furnishings (though the artwork was a little odd). There are two restaurants downstairs, one with casual fare and the other - The William Tell - with creative and upscale fare and some of the best service we've ever received. The location of the hotel was great, too, very convenient for Robson Street shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NMTraveler48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived to be greeted by a plywood front facia and orange barriers at the entrance. Upon entering (no doorman), I finally found the "front desk" in an obviously temporary room. The entire area was dirty due to the construction obviously going on, and the girl at the desk apologized for the mess, but said they were remodeling in anticipation of the Olympics next winter. I asked about our room and she checked us in without any further discussion of the accomodations or rate discount due to the construction. We went to our room, dragging our own bags (no bellman), which was located down a hall with no wallpaper and workmen coming and going. The room was rather small and not nearly as inviting as the pictures on their website. The bed looked very "lumpy" and needed a new duvet, at the least. In fact, virtually nothing on their nicely done website photos really resembled what we actually observed there. We had a view of the side of the colliseum across the street and not much else. As this was a trip booked for a special occasion, and I had called and talked to their reservationist about the accomodations (who did not speak of the view, lack of staff, or the fact that extensive remodeling would be going on), I was very disappointed. After discussing this with my wife for a few minutes, I got on the phone and found a great room at the Westin Bayshore (actually for less money and for a much nicer room and facilities) and then promptly checked out of the Georgian Court. The clerk asked us why (as though there should be any question), and when I told her, she asked if they could offer anything to encourage us to stay. I told her that the reasons we were leaving should have been addressed before we got here, and at the least, some consideration should have been offered when we arrived, not only after they knew we were unsatisfied and were going to leave. I would not recommend this hotel, which could have ruined our trip except for the great people at the Westin Bayshore, which I would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, and great location”
Reviews.Author: egglestn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia, and boy am i glad we did. It is at the bottom end of the main down town area, close to the Junction of Beatty and Robson, and directly across from the BC Place. We asked for a room at the front and on the higher floors by email before arrival, and this was arranged. It also coincided with our wedding anniversary and a large bouquet of flowers was arranged for my wife on the day we arrived. The staff were knowledagable, helpful and friendly. Whilst we were there the world Fireworks championship took place, and the guys behind the desk told us the best place to see the event .

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel, looks better on the website”
Reviews.Author: lolly5249
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days with my brother. I booked it due to its location (my friend lives across the road). It's ok and not far from downtown. The rooms were clean but it looked a fair bit older than the photos on the website (and that is on top of taking the website pictures with a pinch of salt!). The rooms were quiet and had all the needed amenities. The staff were friendly. Overall a pleasant stay. Just not as 'nice' looking as it seems on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: whateasy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights on our way back from Whistler. The hotel is in a central location, and I agree with some of the previous reviews, if you venture a bit further to the wrong direction, you can end up in dodgy bits. But if you take all the right turns, you are very close to Yale Town and Robson streets etc. The hotel itself is in a nice neighbourhood, and i never felt unsafe around there. The check-in staff were very friendly and helpful, and voluntarily give suggestions in nearby eatery during the check-in, as we arrived during lunch hour. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. The Aveda toiletries were a nice touch. The double beds are a bit small for two people (if you want to be cozy), we ended up sleeping in seperate beds, but the beds are very comfortable. The wireless internet is complimentary, but we found the internet speed to be very slow at times. Only other criticism is the doors to the corridor seems to be very thin, and we were woken up several times by inconsiderate travellers talking very loudly in the corridor and slamming doors in the middle of the night on the 2nd night. There is underground parking within the hotel, and they charge $13 per 24 hour, which seems to be a lot cheaper than some other hotels in Vancouver area.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GingerTravellingScot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in August 2008 with my girlfriend during a three week summer holiday. We were driving around BC so the basement car park was great and reasonable value compared to the rest of our trip. We had a standard double room overlooking the BC Stadium and had a large (comfortable) double bed, dressing table, sofa, large mirror and built in wardrobe. Throughout the room and bathroom all the fixtures and fittings were relatively modern and clean. We found this hotel and good base from which to explore Vancouver for a couple days and reasonable value compared to what else was on offer. The breakfast in the ground floor restaurant provided a typical hot and cold buffet set up. We only had it once as not use to large breakasts! If in Vancouver again we would consider this hotel again due to it's central location and reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “My new choice in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: garblinski
Reviews.Content: I come to vancouver on buisness about 6-10 times per year, usually staying downtown. I have stayed at many hotels in Vancouver ( as well as across BC and beyond ), and have found a couple I usually choose. The Georgian Court had their winter rates starting, so I stayed for the first time in November. Checkin was fast, curteous and helpful, even though I was making a change to my reservation. The room was great - clean, spacious and had 10' ceilings. The bed and pillows were comfy, the linens and towels nice and the bathroom large. The toiletries were all by Aveda - very nice. Room came with complimentary bottled water ( $4.95 each at the Hyatt ) and Torrefazione coffee. There were also bathrobes provided. I found the hotel exceptional for the price and is my new favourite in Vancouver. Highly reccommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Georgian Court is Always Excellent”
Reviews.Author: OceanB333
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times in the past. On my most recent visit, I was entirely pleased with the wonderful service, cleanliness and overall stay. Perhaps the only drawback is that room-service is a bit steep. $44.00 for breakfast for 2 (eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, tea, OJ), however service was timely and came with all the necessary condiments and ample amounts of food. Very comfortable bed, great pillows, the robes are an excellent touch. Would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “No Problems At All”
Reviews.Author: Ray170
Reviews.Content: Good start when we arrived at the hotel at 1.30AM and the chap on Reception warmly welcomed us and asked if we had eaten. Upon being told we hadn't he rang a couple of places for us and we soon had a reasonable meal delivered. The guy couldn't have been more helpful. He aplogised that there was no-one carry our bags but maybe security would help - wasn't a problem for us. Sadly we forgot to tip him in our tired state and we expected to catch up with him later but never saw him again. The hotel room was quite clean and tidy and most acceptable. Not sure how much we paid but it wasn't cheap but the area was quite ok and plenty of places to eat around abouts.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy and overpriced hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Atter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the worst service, the rooms are, at best, mediocare and the overall ambienace is very poor. The restaurant downStairs, William Tell, serves average food that's way over priced. Their serivce is just lousy! From the time that we arrived from Seattle, to conclude our Pacific NW vacation in Vancouver, things went downhill. The people that work at the small front desk were not friendly, not courteous nor helpfull. When we asked for their opinion to some local attractions, they refered us to the magazines in our rooms. The next day, our room wasn't made unitl 4:00 PM. When we asked them why, they said that housekeeping was busy catering to a group checking in and that they will get to it when they're ready. The rooms are mediocare and the overall hotel experience is a 3 star at best. Not worth the type of money we were paying. WE WOULDN'T STAY HERE IF THEY PAID US!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: chinsb
Reviews.Content: Not knowing where to stay in our 1st trip to Vancouver, a friend suggested we go to Hotwire, where we booked Georgian Court, a "4-star" hotel. Subsequent to booking through Hotwire, I looked up the hotel website to find that the rate was only $6/night more than Hotwire. At check-in, we were excited to be in Vancouver and approached the front desk with big smiles. We did not get a smile in return. The attitude was one of nose-in-the air. Immediately they called the busboy to carry our luggage (we had only carry-ons and usually prefer to carry our own) without asking us. We found the room to be OK in size. View was of the construction across the street. Even though we specified 3 persons in booking as well as at check-in, we found only 1 bathrobe/slippers in closet, and only 2 sets of towels in bathroom. The worst thing was that the black coffee maker and another black appliance in the room were covered with a film of white dust (see 2 pix). We were grossed out and didn't touch these throughout our stay. Sure enough, they were never cleaned and remained dusty day to day. I had to leave a daily note to the maid to leave us 3 sets of towels (with her tip). There was no bath fan in the bathroom. We asked for maps twice, and both times the reception person looked doubtful and said, mmm...not sure if we have any left, only to look down and find a map. The computer access consisted of a single standing kiosk in a stifling old phonebooth. Bottled water was supposed to be provided every day, but they ran out of water in 3 of the 5 days we were there. After we came home I realized I left a favorite pr of flipflops in the room. Although these were only $10 flipflips, comfortable ones are hard to come by, so I called the hotel to see if they found them. They did, and the housekeeper asked me for my credit card. Apparently this hotel isn't one of those who would send you a lost item out of goodwill. She said it wouldn't cost much for ground delivery, so I said OK. The $10 flipflips turned out to cost $13.35 to send back to me... The only positive things I have to say about this hotel is the location (convenient) and the linens (nice). The "style" of this hotel appears to be the kind that caters to older travelers (much older). Next time, we'll stay at Hampton Inn next door. I think the 3 stars I'm giving it now is generous...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Lafoxster
Reviews.Content: I'd definitely recommend staying at this hotel. It's right around the corner from Robson street so all the wonderful dinning and shopping is literally a few minutes away. Clean & spacious rooms, very friendly staff, great little amenities (love the Aveda products!), wonderful location...I really have no complaints. We required assistance a couple of times and the response was extremely quick and cordial. We were able to get everywhere (Stanley Park, Gastown, Sea Bus) by walking. Do be careful though and keep in mind that this hotel is located on the border of the not so nice area of downtown so if you walk just 3 minutes the wrong way things could get alarming! We found ourselves amongst homeless folk and shady characters badgering us for money quite often. This was the only downside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: idrawart
Reviews.Content: Great room, free bottled water, coffee and tea in room. Aveda products in bath. Nice size bathroom with plenty of big towels. Fantastic maid service. Clean and quiet rooms. pillows were a big overstuffed for our liking. beds were warm and comfy. Room had a desk, TV, 2 chairs and table. nice little closet with safe. Our first room, because we arrived late, was noisy in the back and when you opened the curtains you were looking at all the office workers across the alley looking at you. ask for a room in the front, MUCH better. We moved the second day to the front, great views and quiet. 1102 was our end of corridor room. ( it has an a joining door to next room, so if you get someone noisy in there it could be bad) we had peace and quiet. Staff at front desk was kind and helpful, the bellman was great. I have no idea how a disabled person gets in as there are stairs all along the front. we used the whirlpool and sauna, nice little work out room. Restaurant was nice, simple german menu. pub next door very limited for food, go elsewhere. Metro had a fun seafood menu and you order by the ounce at night. Give it a try. We walked all over and loved the skytrain and bus system. if oyu get the $9.00 all day pass, you can use the skytrain and busses to get everywhere including the Aquaruim and Stanley park. Skytrain goes to the biggest mall in town. The Skytrain is about 2-3 blocks away. Robson street with all the cool shopping is one block away. There is a Starbucks on every block, not kidding. sometimes 2 on a corner. weird. light rain fell on us for 2 of the 3 days we were there. and rain hat or umbrella kept us dry. Got a great haircut at Suki's for $50 bucks, beats a cut in CA. :)

Reviews.Title: “This place gets all of the little details right.”
Reviews.Author: mntneerjay
Reviews.Content: It is easy to get the big things right. The difference between a great place and a so-so place are the little details. The Georgian Court does the details. After searching online for a while, we finally setteled on the Georgian Court for our Vancouver stay. It was a little more pricy than other downtown hotels, but rated highly on this site. I now know why. First off, the location is very good. It was an easy walk to Yaletown, Robson Street, Gastown, China Town, and stations for the light rail and the Aquabus. We had a car, but never used it. A car would only be needed for Stanley Park or the attractions off of the downtown peninsula. The facility was very nice. They did all of the little details right: robes, tourism information, double sheets, extra pillows and towels, coffee/tea bar, extra phones, etc. The room was also very clean, very quiet, and in the morning, very dark. The staff was also first class. There was never a wait at the front desk. They were helpful with directions and recommendations. And most impressive, when their was a problem with getting the room safe open, they were very responsive and dedicated in fixing the problem when they could have easily dismissed us and told us that we had to wait for the technician hours later. The extra effort and care was very impressive. This place is worth the little extra expense!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: milkyoz
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Georgian...what a great way to end our trip....everything about the hotel was great...best king bed we have slept in....highly recccomend this hotel ....staff, rooms and restaurent were all first class

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: KipF
Reviews.Content: Very well appointed rooms, super friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are fairly quiet and the location is great. Some of the reviews here claim the area is sketchy. This is true of the outlying areas, but if you stick to Robson you'll be fine. Otherwise, take a cab. They are not expensive in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all........”
Reviews.Author: okop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business........Your never really sure when it comes to private hotels ( not the regular chains ) but this was not bad at all. Front desk was very polite, helpful and courteous at all times as was the staff in the attached restaurant. Rooms were very clean and beds / linens were surprisingly good. I had excellent sleeps. Bath products are by Aveda which is a nice touch.......Two free bottles of water in room replenished daily......another nice touch not having to pay $4.00 a bottle like some other hotels. We used a meeting room for one day which was a good facility plus they provided excellent service for breaks which included soft drinks; coffee etc., with freshly baked chocolate chip cookies and a bunch of other things........Very good..The price is cheaper than some of the other downtown hotels by a fairly wide margin.......The only thing that could use some attention I thought was the shower would never get nice and hot only warm almost hitting hot ( no big deal ) and the pressure was very weak. If you are thinking about trying it out I would definately give it a shot. The Shark Club right around the corner in the Sandman is a good place to watch a hockey game etc., as it is a Sports Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location if you like walking”
Reviews.Author: familyideals
Reviews.Content: Our last hotel on tour and perhaps we were a little tired because the hotel really didn't stand out compared to others we had stayed in throughout the Rockies. Room was comfortable and clean but a little tired itself. In a handy part of Vancouver if you enjoy walking. Places like Robson Street for shopping are quite close but be careful not to take a wrong turn because some of the streets can be a little scary. The hotel foyer is quite small although staff were friendly and there is a bar/bistro which from memory you enter from the foyer where we relaxed and unwound from our exploring. Staff were always happy to get taxis for us when we wanted to go further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, a bit noisy during football season”
Reviews.Author: crysuni
Reviews.Content: I liked the location of this hotel. Close to everything my sister and I wanted. Shopping downtown on Robson, Yaletown, Chinatown and the seabus. We went for the weekend and there turned out to be a football game on the Saturday night. I didn't notice the huge building across the street facing the front before Saturday night. We were on the backside. We came up to the hotel after a long day of shopping and there was a stage, band and football pre party in the street. Right in the resturant of the hotel there was a long line up for what looked like a hot dog buffet. It was a bit of a shock. I didn't mind but I could see how it might bother other guests. We went for dinner and a walk around downtown, then returned to the hotel. From inside we could hear the crowds cheers, more like the vibrations. When the game was over you could hear the streets fill up with people ready to party. The hotel itself is typical. More elegant then most. Great service, friendly people. I would stay there again, but would be careful who I recommend the hotel to during football season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarang
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through 'pureCanada' website and paid about 50 pounds per night for a king sized bed room on the 11th floor. It was a bargain! The hotel front is not that big and luxurious but the room is well maintained and the hotel staffs are very very kind and helpful. I absolutely loved them! The location of this hotel is just outside of downtown though it is still within the walking distance from the downtown. (about 5-10mins). The good thing about this hotel is there is free internet connection as long as you stay there (if you have a laptop) and it's very close to the bus depot which links Vancouver city to other cites. The bathroom is good and if you are a lady, you will love the Aveda toiletries provided by the hotel (facial soap, bath soap, body lotion, shampoo and conditioner). We didn't try the breakfast as it seemed a bit expensive. There are many restraunts around the hotel, so you can easily get subway sandwich(2min from the hotel) or Mcdonald's breakfast. I already miss Vancouver. Vancouver is a lovely city with nice people and environment. I would definitely go back and will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Understated charm”
Reviews.Author: nickwooten
Reviews.Content: Elegant, low-key, immaculate. Lovely room with excellent amenities. Very good little fitness room with up-to-date equipment. Probably not suitable for travelers with children but a wonderful boutique hotel for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: BAZNPAT
Reviews.Content: First class hotel Beds to die for,Location excellent right opposite BC PLACE for Hockey and concerts. If we go again and we r in 2009 we will be staying here. If you go 100 yards to the right is Dix Brewing Pub excellent real ale and food and sport. If you want any info on vancouver just ask me our friends have lived there for 28 years and know the lot, Anyway hotel is a must. BOOK IT THRU OTEL.COM This was £235 for 4 nights room only . Hotel.com & hotel.connect wanted £480 for the same be carefull.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: EMA375
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights back in Sept. 2006. It was my husband and my first trip to Vancouver. We weren't as excited about the location but the friendly staff made up for it. We bugged them daily on restaurants, tours, etc. Always willing to chat and help in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Homeless People in the Georgian”
Reviews.Author: travlnfromSeattle
Reviews.Content: I have never been more unhappy with my experience at a hotel! Someone was banging very hard and very loud at our door, my husband tried to speak to the man through the door and tell him he had the wrong room. The man stunk so bad you could smell it in the room, he was clearly drunk and slurring his words and very very angry. I had to call the front desk twice and after they sent someone up to remove the man, the manager came to our room and asked us if we knew the man and indicated the man said he knew us. We told him absolutely not and the manager immediately changed stories and said that the man had a room in the hotel but was just lost. We told the manager that we feared the door was coming in and we told the man he had the wrong room and the manager half heartedly apologized and said the man would not bother us anymore. What is worse is that when we left about 20 minutes later, the man was outside the hotel digging in the garbage can - outside the hotel! We were pretty sure the manger lied to us, and there was our proof! I would never recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “location???”
Reviews.Author: dalblair
Reviews.Content: I cant agree with all those reviews that rave about the location. It is ok if you are football or hockey fan, very close to both, but it is quite a walk to the main resturant and shopping area. At night the area round the hotel is very quiet with a lot of building sites around it make one feel a bit uncomfortable.. Having said that the hotel itself is ok, we were upgraded to a suite, large bedroom ,seperate large sitting area, so no cpmplaints there. The staff were all very friendly and efffficient, cant comment on the resturant other than breakfast which was ok. Would look for something more central if returning to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel, but nice”
Reviews.Author: sb42
Reviews.Content: On vacation in Vancouver/Victoria. I would stay at this hotel in the future but if you are walking it is a hike to the shopping district. This hotel is dirctly across from the bc center. We had a corner suite which was very nice, 2 rooms, always a plus. The best thing at this hotel is the Chocolate Sauce/deserts at William Tell Restaurant. Also, Yaletown had very nice quaint shops and a very good Thai restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but location and service problems”
Reviews.Author: Ventureer
Reviews.Content: Having been booked into the Hotel for four nights as part of a tour we found the location if walking out towards Gas Town & China Town could be somewhat threatening. You would not be wise to attempt to walk between Gas Town and China Town in the evening. The Hotel did not have the best location. The rooms were well appointed with large beds and clean linen, the bathroom likewise was clean with ample towelling and of a good size. Having made use of Room Service on our first night having flown in from the UK. We experienced a meal and service of the poorest quality . As a result we used the Hotel as a base and ate elsewhere during our stay in Vancouver. Other menbers of our Tour Party experiencd problems with the quality of the service at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: yodi75
Reviews.Content: Room was very comfortable. Exercise room was very complete and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: eyeswideawake
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into Georgian Court Hotel, Vancouver BC on 8 July - Room 407 - it was the worst hotel stay of our lives. Don't get me wrong - the room was nice and clean, plenty of pillows, comfortable bed linens, Aveda toiletries, etc. The only BIG problem was the air-conditioner - there was a constant vibrating noise. It would start with a loud noise from the motor, followed by the vibrating noise for a couple of minutes and ending with the same loud motor noise. After that there would be a couple minutes of silence and then it would start all over again with the same duration throughout the day and night. When I complained about it to the relation officer at front desk the next morning- I was told by the PERSON whom I spoke with that all the rooms in the hotel had the same problem and nothing could be done about it. On the 4th night I spoke with another relation officer at the front desk - Paul - I think that's his name. He got the porter to go up to the room with us and the porter confirmed that there was something wrong with the air-conditioner but that it could be rectified by a technician in a couple of hours. If only we had spoken to Paul instead of the "could not be bothered" officer after the 1st night. We hardly slept during the 5-night stay and it was the worst hotel stay of our lives. We checked out on 13 July to board a ship on an Alaskan cruise.

Reviews.Title: “You can believe all the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: RGT4
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 15 night stay at the Georgian Court and you can believe all of the positive reviews in Trip Advisor. This is an excellent hotel in an excellent downtown location. Staff, rooms, restaurant, cleanliness, efficiency and all aspects of our stay were great and we would not look elsewhere for a stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Zacharius
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotels.com for a great rate. Arrived into Vancouver and the first room had no internet connection, so they immediately moved me to a room that did. Staff was fantastic about check-in, recommending places to eat, etc. Just two blocks from a metro stop, and about 4-5 blocks from some great Chinatown restaurants. Beds were very comfortable, rooms were not huge but good sized, as were the bathrooms. Other than that, not much to say - would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: high.rise
Reviews.Content: We arrived really early and staff were very accommodating, providing our room well ahead of check in time. Location is ideal for downtown, skytrain station is only a few blocks away. Room was large and well appointed. Bed was very comfortable. Bathrooms have nice selection of products. Rooms were serviced in quick time and are very clean. There were no events at the stadium during our stay but it is right across the road. Free internet access for guests, laptops can be rented in room or there is a quick station at reception which is a great facility for just checking email etc. Check out not until 1pm and can be extended for a fee. Overall a very enjoyable stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKTravelCheshireEng
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in April 2007.The room was large and the beds were extremely comfortable. The rooms were cleaned efficiently each day. The Avieda bathroom products were very welcome. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous at all times. The hotel is very conveniently situated for exploring downtown Vancouver, False Creek and Granville Island. We ate breakfast at a superb cafe in the Yaletown area about 4 blocks from the hotel. There are many restaurants and lovely walks along the waterfront in Yaletown close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short trip to Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Kiel9495
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March 2007. It was great. Friendly staff, very comfy and clean rooms, and the hotel is well situated for the city centre. Our room was quiet, very clean, with two double beds in the room and a excellent bathroom. We stayed room-only, so we didn't try out the breakfast, but there are plenty of good options locally. One evening we ate at the hotel sports bar ("Beatty Street Bar & Grill") right next door - good simple food and once again very friendly staff. This was our first visit to Vancouver, and we found the hotel was well-situated. It is at one end of the city centre rather than bang in the middle, but the city centre is an easily walkable grid, and the local buses are good anyway if you can't face a walk. All in all, a good place, and one we would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location for events!”
Reviews.Author: cynlouhoo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Georgian Court several times for concerts at both the GM Place and the Queen E Theatre. Easy walking distance to both (and of course BC Place). The rooms are nicely decorated and the Aveda bathroom products are wonderful! The beds are very comfortable too. The only complaint I have at all is that the fan in the bathroom didn't really clear the steam from showering (I have noticed this in other rooms there too). If they were to upgrade anything, that would be something to consider. Oh yeah.....slow elevators too, but not sure what can be done about that. :-) Otherwise, we always enjoy our stays at this hotel and it will always be our number one choice when attending any of the venues it is close to.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie_in_Seattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night (2/16/07) and the hotel exceeded my expectations. I booked the hotel via the hotel's website and paid $139CDN+tax. Although I arrived around midnight, the staff were very cheerful and helpful. Parking is secure and only $9/night. I inquired about parking in their garage for several hours after checking out on Saturday and was told that it would be no problem and I would not be charged for the extra time. The room was quite spacious, very clean, and well-organized. Little touches, like free bottles of water and Aveda bath products, were appreciated. I did not hear any street noise or noise from other guests during my stay. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from BC Place stadium and is walking distance or easy driving access to Vancouver's attractions. One word of caution - if you are driving to the hotel using the hotel's directions posted on their website, be aware that there is major construction on Cambie Street, making it difficult if not impossible to follow the directions. Contact the hotel or consult maps beforehand to figure out another way to the hotel. It appeared that Cambie Street construction will be ongoing throughout 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garg_NO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is placed close to Robson street, Yaletown and the rest of downtown. Everything is within walking range. I stayed here for 8 days and truly enjoyed it. The service is good, and you get help for everything if you need it. If I am going back to Vancouver sometime, I ll use this hotel again. - Geir (Norwegian visitor)

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: salsa06
Reviews.Content: location is not amazing for night time coming home but you can always get a taxi! lovely lovely hotel lovely lovely staff

Reviews.Title: “Just Wasn't Long Enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very charming-the staff we met were helpful and so pkeasant-especially Pino!! He truely understands "service". The bed was terrific....a very enjoyable stay.
